Glacier surged vigorously in 2017-2018; measurement accuracy  +/- 0.2 C; time-series available from Gwenn Flowers

site_description: central ablation area of small valley glacier
notes: Glacier is not surge-type. Ice thickness is ~110m in borehole location. +/- 0.1 C. The false precision reported for temperature is a consequence of converting values read out in F to C (!). Supporting information in study 74.

site_description: central ablation area of small surge-type valley glacier
notes: Glacier is surge-type and last surged vigorously in the 1980s. Interpreted to be undergoing a "slow surge" (see https://tc.copernicus.org/articles/5/299/2011/) at the time of temperature measurement. Time-series available from Gwenn Flowers. Supporting information in study 74.
Two-week average; Full time-series (2014-11-09 to 2015-02-08) available from ICIMOD / Tika Gurung.
